main_definition: Doors are entryways or barriers that can be opened or closed to allow or prevent access, also used metaphorically in idiomatic expressions.

meanings_and_examples.example: I'll knock on the doors of every house until I find my lost dog.
The new job offer is a door to a brighter future for me.
She agreed to the terms of the contract, opening the door to collaboration.
When he missed his train, it was a closed door to that job interview.
This new project is the first door through which we can explore uncharted territory in our field.
